nodes.title: CFG Note
widgets_values:
More CFG means better prompt adherence but longer generation time. Its set as "1.0" by default. 

1.0 is needed for speed-up's like 4/8-step models/LoRAs

Fell free to change it and test new configurations. Use values between "1" and "1.5".

(1 disables/ignores the negative prompt!)

nodes.title: Shift Note
widgets_values:
Shift is set to "5" by default.  Feel free to change it and test new configurations.

WAN 2.2 is valid from 5-8.

nodes.title: Steps total Note
widgets_values:
Change the steps here, the math will be done by the node.

More steps means better quality but longer generation time. Its set as "4" by default. Fell free to change it and test new configurations. Use even numbers!

nodes.title: Step to swap Note
widgets_values: Set to "2" by default. What is 50% of the 4 steps. Feel free to change it and test new configurations.

nodes.title: Frames Note
widgets_values:
Set The lenght of your video!

3sec - 49
4sec - 65
5sec - 81
6sec - 97
7sec - 113

nodes.title: CRF note
widgets_values:
The compression level of the video.
19 "lossless" is default.

nodes.title: Seed Note
widgets_values:
Seed: -1, random outcome every time

Set a seed if you want to have the same outcome every time or only want the other components the random part

Write your positive prompt!
1) Brief description of the setting/appearance
2) Actions, motions, story
3) Camera composition

nodes.title: CFG + NAG Note
widgets_values:
CFG 1 normally disables/ignores the negative prompt!

NAG effectively enables negative prompting on CFG 1.

nodes.title: Lora Note
widgets_values:
Try to use without LoRA first, to have a comparison.

Add LoRAs to your liking.

nodes.title: Video size Note
widgets_values:
Set your initial video Size with the correct aspect you want.
By default its set to 528x768 (2:3).
This has the most impact on your time needed to sample the video, consumed VRAM and RAM.

Feel free to change anything it to fit your own specs.
Just the standard WAN 2.2 negatives. Leave as is.

nodes.title: Features
widgets_values: Enable features you want to use.

nodes.title: Math final resolution Note
widgets_values:
The final resolution will be will be 2 times the "start resolution" while maintaining the aspect ratio and aspect of the video.

No morph, Aspect correct to optimal WAN resolution.

VAE: Still using the same as the wan 2.1 

CLIP:
Just your prefered standard CLIP text encoder.
No CLIP Vision H, this is not traided and implemented in WAN 2.2 - There is no need for this, the weights are disabled.

CLIP can be offloaded to CPU for VRAM savings -> device = "cpu"

If your VRAM is enough, you can device = "default" for faster inference speed

The last frame of you final result.

This will always select the last run method, even if you selected multiple options! (Interpolation node > FLF2V node > i2v only)

The image will be saved on the same folder as your video.
You can start with this again to expand your video.
Here you set your last frame of your video.

nodes.title: Video codec, CRF and features
widgets_values:
### üé• H.265 (MP4) CRF Recommendations for WAN 2.2 + RIFE
---

| Purpose | CRF | Notes |
|----------|-----|-------|
| Master / Archival | 19 | Nearly lossless; best for grading or editing |
| Final Render | 20‚Äì22 | Ideal quality-to-size balance |
| Web / Social | 23‚Äì25 | Lighter files, still decent |
| Previews / Tests | 25‚Äì27 | Quick generation, visible compression |

---


üí° *Tip:* For AI-generated videos, CRF 19-21 gives extreme good results with minimal size. H265 is in every way superior to H264 - better compression, better motion estimation, better colors.

---
### NAG
This will use your negative condition and concat it with the standard WAN AI negative prompt for convenience.

If you do not want this, just disable the standard negative node.

‚ö†Ô∏èNAG needs a lot of VRAM, so if you do not need this. Just let it be disabled.

### Interpolation
This will interpolate your video to double fps at the end.

Choose the type of Checkpoint to use.

Wan 2.2 uses a different diffusion model for the first steps (high noise) vs the last steps (low noise).

You can ether use safetensors or gguf.

## Model links

**text_encoders**

- [umt5_xxl_fp8_e4m3fn_scaled.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Comfy-Org/Wan_2.2_ComfyUI_Repackaged/resolve/main/split_files/text_encoders/umt5_xxl_fp8_e4m3fn_scaled.safetensors)

**model**

- [DaSiWa WAN 2.2 i2v 14B (S) Lightspeed](https://civitai.com/models/1981116)
   
  OR
- [DaSiWa WAN 2.2 i2v 14B (G) Lightspeed](https://civitai.com/models/2190659)

**vae**

## Model Storage Location

```
üìÇ ComfyUI/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÇ models/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÇ text_encoders/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ umt5_xxl_fp8_e4m3fn_scaled.safetensors
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÇ checkpoints/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ dasiwa-wan2.2-i2v-lightspeed.safetensors
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÇ diffusion-models/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ dasiwa-wan2.2-i2v-lightspeed.gguf
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÇ vae/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ wan_2.1_vae.safetensors
```
Here you set your initial image (frame) of your video.

# HowTo use
1. Set checkpoints
2. Set Clip + VAE
3. (optional) add LoRAs
4. Enable Featuras you want at the "Features - Switch"
5. Tune any parameter to your liking under "BASIC SETTINGS"
6. Add images you need
8. Generate

nodes.title: Changelog
widgets_values:
## Requirements
- https://github.com/Kosinkadink/ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite
- https://github.com/rgthree/rgthree-comfy
- https://github.com/Artificial-Sweetener/comfyui-WhiteRabbit  
  *packaging, torchlanc*
- https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-KJNodes
- https://github.com/yolain/ComfyUI-Easy-Use

---

## Features

- üß© **Automatic aspect‚Äëratio fitting**
- üñºÔ∏è **Monitor‚Äëresolution selective upscaling**
- ‚ú® **Ultra‚Äëfast, color‚Äëcorrect upscaling** (torchlanc)
- üîñ **Bookmark-Shortcuts** - with number keys
- ü§ù **Video resolution matching** - always optimal Div16 WAN 2.2 resolutions
- **Separated upscale logic** for VRAM saving

---

## Changes
- Changed from subgraph to normal nodes for better monitoring
- Added GGUF support

## Fixes
- none

nodes.title: Upscale
widgets_values: The upscale logic will upscale the final output to 2x initial set resolution.

nodes.title: FPS Note
widgets_values:
The FPS used for videos
16 is default.
24 is possible for fast motion, shorter video.
Your Interpolated FPS will set to 2 times this value.
